# Authors

Arielle COHEN TANUGI-CARRESSE is a PhD Candidate in Economics at Université Paris Nanterre and
Research Assistant with the “Management in Innovative Health” at EDHEC Business School. Her
research focuses on health economics and policy evaluation, particularly how economic shocks
affect the health of aging populations in Europe. French-American, she has academic experience in
both France and the United States. She can be contacted at <arielle.cohentanugicarresse@sciencespo.fr>.

Paul SERVAIS is a PhD Candidate in political science (comparative politics) in the Center for European
and Comparative Politics of Sciences Po. His research analyses the electoral impacts of climate
change’s consequences in France and Western Europe, with a particular focus on territorial
cleavages (urban-rural, center-periphery). His work combines quantitative and qualitative research
methods. He can be reached at <paul.servais@sciencespo.fr>.
